page.title: 18ARDBOE--THE FUTURE
page.content: In common with most other communities, The people of Ardboe have both{hopes {and fears}for the future.Their hopes are those of any small community,good housing,secure employment and so on. Their fears,however,are not those of most small communities.The reason for this is the deposits of {LIGNITE}which have been discovered throughout the area. If this Lignite exists in sufficient quantities,then commercial {mining}would be most likely.The type of open-cast mining,which would follow,would undoubtably be the death knell of this community. This concern is shown by a committee which has been formed by residents of the area to combat such an eventuality.Other residents have expressed their fears in other ways as the following verses show.
